text: Oksana Olegovna Selekhmeteva (; born 13 January 2003) is a Russian tennis player. Selekhmeteva has a career high WTA singles ranking of 668 achieved on 24 June 2019. Selekhmeteva won the 2019 US Open – Girls' Doubles title, and reached the final of the 2019 Wimbledon Girls' Doubles tournament. ==ITF Finals== {|class=wikitable style=font-size:85% |- style="background:#f88379;" | $100,000 tournaments |- style="background:#f7e98e;" | $75,000 tournaments |- style="background:#addfad;" | $50,000 tournaments |- style="background:lightblue;" | $25,000 tournaments |- style="background:#f0f8ff;" | $10,000 tournaments |} ===Doubles (1-0)=== {|class="sortable wikitable" style=font-size:97% !Outcome !No. !Date !Tournament !Surface !Partner !Opponents !Score |- style="background:lightblue;" | bgcolor="98FB98"|Winner | 1. | 6 September 2020 | Marbella, Spain | Clay | Alina Charaeva | Miriam Bulgaru Victoria Muntean | 6–3, 6–2 |} ==Junior Grand Slam titles== ===Doubles: 2 (1 title, 1 runner-up)=== {|class="sortable wikitable" style=font-size:97% |- !Result !Year !width=150|Tournament !Surface !width=150|Partner !width=150|Opponents !width=150|Score |-style="background:#ccffcc;" | style="background:#ffa07a;"|Runner-up | 2019 | Wimbledon | Grass | Kamilla Bartone | Savannah Broadus Abigail Forbes | 5–7, 7–5, 2–6 |- style="background:#ccf;" | style="background:#98fb98;"|Winner |2019 |US Open |Hard | Kamilla Bartone | Aubane Droguet Séléna Janicijevic |7–5, 7–6(8–6) |} ==References== ==External links== * * Category:2003 births Category:Living people Category:Russian female tennis players Category:US Open (tennis) junior champions Category:Tennis players at the 2018 Summer Youth Olympics Category:Grand Slam (tennis) champions in girls' doubles
title: Oksana Selekhmeteva
